title: Great Place To Work
pros: Excellent culture, amazing health benefits and PTO.
cons: The salary is below what a property administrator should be making.

title: Supportive Team/Busy Work
pros: Supportive team, a lot of projects, billing deadlines, working with industry leaders, great management
cons: Small office environment and lack of windows

title: Good benefits, good starting job, not a forever career
pros: Really good benefits, good 401K contribution, you get to see a lot of the property management field that you wouldn't necessarily see at bigger companies who have more help.
cons: Low pay, they run lean which means although you get to see and do alot you are pressured to keep up with everything and get your hand slapped when it's not done to expectations. As they say, it rolls downhill and if your manager is getting it from above and doesn't know how to filter it out you will get it too.

title: Property Manager Review
pros: Benefits and 401K were perks as was vacation time if you could afford to take the time off before losing the days.
cons: Policies and procedures are helpful until they impede productivity. You will stay in a position for a long time without being promoted unless you are in asset management or some other similar corporate capacity. They are also very male dominated.

title: The Good Old Boy Network is Alive and Well in Atlanta!
pros: Upper Management is all smiles, supportive, we love employees attitude for awhile. Your peers are really great people.
cons: When the economy turns, so does their attitude. Be thankful you have a job, eliminate those underneath you to save on overhead and we don't care how - or else we eliminate you.

title: Great Culture
pros: Property management and asset management teams are all friendly. I was treated with respect by everyone that I worked for and with. Company provides good health insurance and a very good 401K plan.
cons: Not so much the company as just the industry. I didn't love property management, some of the tenants are very rude and disrespectful. Some will talk down to you and expect that you bend over backwards for them.

title: Good Experience. Great people
pros: Management is very open and inclusive. Everyone I worked with had high integrity and a high personal standard of excellence. Can't think of a better place to start a career.
cons: Below market pay. Slow career growth at the junior level

title: Great company with a sound business model and direction.
pros: Fantastic benefits. Corporate culture, but employees have a great attitude. Personal growth is encouraged.
cons: Satellite offices can feel left out of events that take place at corporate office.

title: Property Manager
pros: Solid benefits, stock vesting. Quality buildings and tenants. Lean operation.
cons: Lean operation, so you may wear many hats and have a title that understates your position relative to your years in the industry.

title: Company treats you well, the industry wasn't for me
pros:
Smaller company that has welcoming culture
I was always treated with respect
cons:
Dealing with unruly tenants gets old 
Feel like you are babysitting children at times

title: No advancement
pros: Low turnover, great benefits, good work/ life balance
cons: No advancement unless you threaten to leave or your in a certain group, low salary because of incentives

title: Overall Great Company
pros: Great benefits, annual bonus, lots of PTO
cons: Limited room for growth. Good ol' boys club. All white male upper management.

title: Property Management
pros: Great company with talented people throughout the organization.
cons: Communication between corporate and front line management reveals room for improvement.

title: Great place
pros: Family-like environment. Smart people. They make the effort to get to know you.
